Abstract: Based on the sample survey data of grain farmers in Shandong, Hebei and Henan provinces, This paper use Probit model and Mediating Effect Model to analyze the influencing factors of farmers’ adoption behavior of water saving irrigation technology(WSIT) and their income increasing effects. The results show that education years of household head, planting scale, cooperatives membership and perception of water scarcity all significantly promoted farmers’ adoption of water saving irrigation technology. Water saving irrigation technology adoption behavior can significantly increase farmers’ income. After using instrumental variable method to deal with endogenous problems, the regression results are still stable. The adoption of water saving irrigation technology not only has a direct effect on improving household income, but also indirectly increases household income through factor inputs. Therefore, strengthening agricultural technology popularization, guiding and encouraging farmers to join cooperatives, and expanding farmers’ planting scale through land circulation are the keys to improve farmers’ income level. China’s per capita water resource is only a quarter of the world average level, close to the warning line of 1700 cubic meters. Among them, agriculture occupies a dominant position in China's water resources utilization. However, with the advancement of industrialization and urbanization, a large number of industrial water and domestic water occupy agricultural water. Under the current water resources endowment conditions, China’s agricultural water resources are facing severe challenges, the contradiction between supply and demand of agricultural production water resources is prominent, and the utilization efficiency of water resources is not high, which is more serious in irrigated agriculture. International experience shows that popularizing and adopting water saving irrigation technology is an effective way to alleviate the shortage of water resources in agricultural production. Therefore, China attaches great importance to the development of water saving irrigation technologies (WSIT). In 2019, the National Water saving irrigation Action Plan issued by the National Development and Reform Commission and the Ministry of Water Resources emphasized the strict implementation of dual control of water intensity and total amount, and promoted water saving irrigation technologies such as covering soil moisture conservation, spraying micro- irrigation, low-pressure pipe irrigation, and rainwater harvesting and supplementary irrigation. However, in the process of policy implementation, there is a disconnection between government promotion and farmers’ actual adoption, flood irrigation is still widespread, the actual adoption efficiency of agricultural water saving irrigation technology is low, and the effect of increasing income has significant individual differences. How to improve the adoption rate of water saving irrigation technology, and then improve the income level of farmers, has important practical significance. Therefore, clarifying the influencing factors of farmers’ water saving irrigation technology adoption behavior and its mechanism on farmers’ income is particularly important for promoting farmers’ water saving irrigation technology adoption behavior. (1) Influencing factors of farmers’ adoption behavior of water saving irrigation technology. The effect of individual characteristics of farmer households on water saving irrigation technology adoption behavior. The age of household head has a positive effect on the adoption of water saving irrigation technology, the older the head of household is, the less labor intensity he can put into agricultural production, and water saving irrigation technology has the characteristic of saving labor input, so the older the head of household is more willing to adopt water saving irrigation technology. The effect of education years of household head on the adoption of water saving irrigation technology by farmers is positive, the more educated the household head is, the more he realizes the importance of water saving irrigation technology in reducing water waste and protecting the environment, and the probability of adopting water saving irrigation technologies is higher. The effect of risk attitudes on farmers’ adoption behavior of water saving technology is positive, advanced water saving technology such as sprinkler irrigation, has a certain technology risk, and farmers with more positive risk attitude are more willing to adopt water saving technology. Therefore, it is assumed that the elder age of the household head, the more years of education, and the more positive risk attitude have a positive effect on the (2) The effect of farmers’ household characteristics on water saving irrigation technology adoption behavior. The effect of planting years on farmers’ water saving irrigation technology adoption behavior is positive, the richer planting experience, the more sensitive to the technical effects of water saving irrigation technology, and the higher probability of adopting water saving irrigation technology. The effect of planting scale on the adoption behavior of water saving irrigation technology by farmers is positive, sprinkler irrigation and other engineering water saving irrigation technologies have the requirement of minimum scale, and the larger planting scale of farmers, the more income farmers can get and thus the more money farmers can invest in the water saving irrigation technology, which will help farmers to adopt water saving irrigation technology. The effect of family laborers size on the adoption of water saving technology by farmers is negative, water saving technology has the attribute of labor saving, the more family laborers, the more they can meet the labor input for irrigation, and the less to adopt water saving technology. The effect of cooperatives membership on the adoption of water saving irrigation technology by farmers is positive, as cooperatives provide technology publicity, training and guidance, which helps farmers deepen their understanding of water saving irrigation technology and helps adopt water saving irrigation technology. The effect of social network on farmers’ water saving irrigation technology adoption behavior is positive. As a kind of informal system, social network can disseminate technology information through geographic, kinship, and industrial relations, forming the cohort effect of water saving irrigation technology adoption, and farmers who have not adopted water saving irrigation technology can improve the probability of technology adoption through learning and imitation effect. The effect of water scarcity perception on farmers’ water saving irrigation technology adoption behavior is positive, and farmers believe that the more scarce water resources are, the more willing to adopt water saving irrigation technology to reduce irrigation water consumption. Therefore, it is assumed that the longer planting years, the larger planting scale, the larger family laborers size, the larger membership in cooperatives, the larger social network, and the more sensitive water scarcity perception, have a positive effect on (3) Impact of water saving irrigation technology adoption behavior on farmers’ income. Water saving irrigation technology adoption behavior can reduce irrigation time by about 38%, and the reduction in irrigation time correspondingly saves pumping energy and irrigation water (Lampayan et al., 2015; Rejesus et al., 2011)[1-2], can reduce irrigation water use by 25-30% (Rahman and Bulbul, 2015)[3], and thus saves irrigation water costs. In addition to save water, water saving irrigation technology adoption behavior also has the effect of saving other production inputs such as input labor cost, pesticide and fertilizer cost, and seedling cost (Huang et al., 2017)[4]. At the same time, water saving irrigation technology adoption behavior increases average acre yield by reducing crop water use and increasing water productivity, which leads to increased income. Alternate wet and dry irrigation techniques can reduce water use by 25-30% (Kulkarni, 2011)[5], and increase groundwater utilization for higher yields (Carrijo et al., 2017)[6].

The data come from a questionnaire survey of grain growers conducted by the research group in 2019 in the main grain-producing regions of Shandong, Hebei and Henan provinces. The research area is dominated by irrigation districts, mainly relying on the exploitation of groundwater for irrigation, with a relatively complete infrastructure support, which is an important part of guaranteeing grain supply in the north of China. The selection of the questionnaire respondents took the combination of stratified sampling and random sampling, with the county as the unit, and the survey content mainly covered the basic situation of grain growers' families, cost and benefit situation, knowledge and application of water saving irrigation technology, water resource utilization and cognition, and information of their villages, etc. A total of 500 valid questionnaires were obtained, and 450 valid questionnaires were screened out. In order to ensure the quality of the questionnaire and the accuracy of the survey, the questionnaire has been revised many times and pre-survey, and at the same time, the researchers were trained on the questionnaire survey before the survey. Water saving irrigation technology adoption behavior. Water saving irrigation technologies for grain production mainly include six agronomic or engineering technical measures such as drought-resistant varieties, mulching, stubble no-tillage, surface pipelines, sprinkler irrigation, drip irrigation, etc. (Tang et al., 2016) [7], and the water saving irrigation technology adoption behavior variable was measured by whether farmers adopted at least one water saving irrigation technology. farmers’ water scarcity perception as the instrumental variable of farmers’ water saving irrigation technology adoption behavior. It should be noted that farmers’ perception of water scarcity is highly correlated with water saving irrigation technology adoption behavior, the more scarce water resources farmers believe, the higher probability of farmers adopting water saving irrigation technology, while the perception of water scarcity does not directly affect the income level of farmers, so the selection of the instrumental variable is in line with the requirements of relevance and exogeneity. Farmers’ household income. Farmers’ household income includes agricultural income and non-farm income, of which agricultural income is from food sales and subsidies after deducting labor costs and material costs, and non-farm income is wage income. Other variables. Individual characteristic variables such as age, education and risk attitudes, and household characteristic variables such as planting years, planting scale, labor size, social network, and cooperatives membership are added to the model. Instrumental variables. There may be a mutual causality endogeneity problem between farmers’ water saving irrigation technology adoption behavior and farmers’ income, and farmers’ water saving irrigation technology adoption behavior requires a certain economic cost, the higher level of farmers’ income, the higher probability of adopting water saving irrigation technology. Table 2 reports the estimation results. From the Probit estimation results, it can be showed that the education years of household head has a significant positive effect on the adoption behavior of farmers’ water saving irrigation technology, indicating that the higher the level of education, the more farmers realize the importance of water saving irrigation technology in saving costs and increasing yields, and the more they are willing to adopt water saving irrigation technology. The coefficient of planting scale is significantly positive at 1% level, indicating that planting scale can significantly increase the probability of farmers’ water saving irrigation technology adoption behavior, water saving irrigation technology generally has a higher cost, the larger the planting scale of the farmers, the better the burden of adopting water saving irrigation technology, and the better to play the role of economies of scale. Cooperatives membership has a significant positive effect on the adoption of water saving irrigation technology by farmers, indicating that cooperatives can promote the adoption of water saving irrigation technology by providing the latest technology information to member farmers and publicizing the advantages of water saving irrigation technology in saving water and increasing production. The coefficient of social network is significantly positive, indicating that the social network promotes the adoption of water saving irrigation technology by first adopting farmers, thus contributing to the adoption behavior of water saving irrigation technology. The perception of water scarcity has a significant positive effect on the adoption behavior of water saving irrigation technology, indicating that farmers believe that the more scarce water resources are, the higher the possibility of adopting water saving irrigation technology, and that water saving irrigation technology, as a resource saving technology, water scarcity can motivate farmers to adopt water saving irrigation technology.

Second, the adoption behavior of water saving irrigation technology can significantly enhance farmers’ household income, and the regression results are still robust after the instrumental variable method is used to deal with the endogeneity problem, and the education years of household head, the laborers size, and the social network all have a significant role in promoting the income of farmers’ households, while the age of the household head has a significant negative effect on the income of farmers’ households. Third, the results of the impact mechanism of water saving irrigation technology adoption behavior on farmers’ household income show that water saving irrigation technology adoption behavior not only has a direct improvement effect on the income of farmers’ households, but also indirectly improves farmers’ household income through factor inputs. First, increasing the promotion of agricultural technologies such as water saving irrigation technology, improve the coverage of technical extension services, adopt technical training, agrotechnology publicity, policy subsidies, etc., through the provision of financial subsidies and policy support to encourage farmers to adopt water saving irrigation technology, improve farmers’ knowledge of water saving irrigation technology in saving water resources, improving yields, and protecting the environment, and increase the support for the initial investment in equipment and later maintenance.
